Key Match Events: Dunith Wellalage led the way with three wickets in his debut match as Sri Lanka beat West Indies by 73 runs in the second Twenty20 match on Tuesday to level the three-match series 1-1.
Pathum Nissanka made 54 runs off 49 deliveries for Sri Lanka including a six and nine boundaries.
Fast bowler Romario Shepherd took 2-23 for the West Indies.

Wellalage had Brandon King, who top scored in the first match, stumped by Kusal Mendis for 5 and had both Andre Fletcher (4) and Roston Chase (4) caught by Kamindu Mendis to finish with three wickets for nine runs in his four overs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: In reply, the West Indies were bowled out for 89 in the 17th over, handing the hosts their largest win by runs against the West Indies.
The third and series-deciding match will be played at the same venue on Thursday.
